differences.gitbook:
The first meeting for the regional expansion of the Ambassador program for the LATAM region was a small success, with 11 participants and a strong sense of community.
After a short introduction and a small personal presentation of those present we start with the meeting agenda.

In this introductory meeting, we share with the community the proposal voted and approved by the global community of ambassadors. We went through the objectives and strategy for this starting phase.


The tools used by the community were presented, Discors, Dework and the Oracle archive
differences.supabase: At the second meeting for the regional expansion of the Ambassadors program for the LATAM region, we carried out a second introduction of the program where we reinforced the objectives and strategies of the program. Unlike the African Guild, which has core contributor members on its team, the members of the LATAM region are new to the program and the initiation in many cases is from scratch, that is why we reinforced the introduction to the program, the value proposition and developed the most relevant points to be able to address the candidate training strategy. Governance: We discussed the usefulness and use of ‘Chilli Pepper’ LATAM Guilds Token for the Guilds reputation system and self governance. Q3 Budget proposal update and situation status.

differences.gitbook: Beginning Onboarding evaluation and selection of members
differences.supabase: Onboarding evaluation and selection of members

differences.gitbook: Evaluate the execution of workshops on the tools used by the community
differences.supabase: Operations and Roadmap Draft second Revision

differences.gitbook:
The onboarding strategy was communicated to those present and the next steps to follow in the formation of the core contributors team for this initial stage were proposed, onboarding evaluation and selection.


At the end of the meeting, the onboarding form for the LATAM regional expansion program was shared.
differences.supabase:
We outline the needs and objectives of the onboarding strategy and the next steps for forming the core contributors team for the beginning of the program.

A status report was made on the number of members who have responded to the call and at  the end of the meeting, the updated version in three languages ​​of the onboarding form for the LATAM regional expansion program was shared.

differences.gitbook: Edit Onboarding form and perform an update on two languages, Spanish and Portuguese
differences.supabase: Follow up onboarding form and study candidates before evaluation

supabase.text: Communication content for onboarding call 2 action and announcements of next biweekly townhall

differences.gitbook: The need was established for Initial documentation translated into Spanish to begin educating members on the forms and methodologies of the program.
differences.supabase: Initial documentation translated into Spanish was shared to begin educating members on the forms and methodologies of the program. We went back to review the tools used by the community, Discors, Dework and the Oracle archive and we reviewed the main bases of their use.
Initial documentation translated into Spanish x3
